3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:00): adactio, my optimistic guess at what may be happening is that the author of that post got the microdata wrong (because it *is* harder), their data was thus not all picked up, and thus the snippets didn't work as expected.
3decbf68220417c2cd9f1297dad4514a (19:01): Ah! That could be the case ...which would be an interesting case study.
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:02): I'm just guessing here
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:02): trying to give Google the benefit of the doubt
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:02): and knowing how hard it is to get such markup/encoding "right"
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:04): agrees with Ann
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:04): reserve the spot
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:05): if no agenda materializes then call is cancelled
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:05): what Jeff said
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:05): thanks everyone
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:05): will also add some straw thoughts on sessions
3c1a153d81002878b83df957ee534f47 (19:05): related to what came out of the schema.org workshop
